intro: Sagenia macrodonta, commonly known as the large-fruit sage, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. Sagenia macrodonta typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
